document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

AC6C33823AA142C49D63E38F8B859466.description:
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of all sources, including the Internet, Artificial
Intelligence (AI), and new technologies, as they develop.

99C75D59DBFE4FA09C790A1D755B5F13.description:
Give credit for information quoted or paraphrased, using standard citations (e.g., author,
article title and webpage, and publication date).

390BE600D27F4A9B9DEAC7E1967F9A69.description: Organize and share findings in formal and informal oral written formats.

8168E242B05243879A1D8B1D26ECDDD0.description:
Quote, summarize, and paraphrase research findings from primary and secondary sources,
avoiding plagiarism by using own words and following ethical and legal guidelines.

465D6EA67FCB419FABF550B0A70DE71A.description:
Evaluate and analyze the relevance, validity, and credibility of each source (primary,
secondary, digital, and print), determining what information to include and exclude.

4142F8438F3F4E28B2D48A5E8A50FED9.description:
Collect, organize, and synthesize information from multiple sources using various
notetaking formats.

B6DB0D86F68A47A9B4D83052D37B1146.description:
Formulate questions about a research topic, broadening or narrowing the inquiry as
necessary.

B4368D703519438183DA334AE9146FD8.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade seven content and texts, solve problems, and
support cross-curricular learning.

E908FDA5984246DC9398369D6FCCBAC8.description:
Compare and contrast the effectiveness of techniques in auditory, visual, and written media
messages (e.g., authorship, format, content, purpose) on the intended audience.

1B3579BA183B4FE58E787029EE826DE6.description:
Analyze media messages for facts, opinions, persuasive messages, word choice, and
viewpoint.

BA0C01FD597F4DF5913C801E93E05DF5.description:
Explain persuasive/informative techniques used in media to sway the audience (e.g.,
innuendo, card stacking, bandwagon, and appeal to emotions).

4F68F4AE33AB43B68A1D00400A6052A2.description:
Craft and publish audience-specific media messages that present claims and findings with
relevant evidence in a logical sequence.

3F8BE5C0718C4CDDA8125141D6942A73.description:
Use medial and visual literacy skills to select, organize, and create multimodal content that
articulates and enhances the purpose of the presentation using two or more communication modes to make meaning (e.g., still or moving images, gestures, spoken language, and
written language).

F25378B2823B4B7592795EDA62E32D50.description:
Memorize and recite a poem demonstrating inflection and meaningful expression that is
appropriate to the tone and voice of the selection.

37554FC6599642DDBECCB3EF770FD0AF.description: Referencing source material as appropriate during the presentation.

C4CA81D498A64A228902E5412C448C75.description:
Responding to audience questions and comments with relevant evidence,
observations, and ideas.

B6A395D3A2FF4DBABBE0AE9B82D087BF.description:
Adjusting verbal and nonverbal communication skills appropriate to audience,
topic, and purpose to enhance the overall message.

30A5890E2BAF4540933D5E799C72E47F.description:
Providing evidence to support the main ideas, including pertinent descriptions,
facts, details, and examples.

CEB8E6D1BE2049E38BD35B5FAE690938.description: Clearly communicating information in an organized and succinct manner.

5AE658869ACD4C278E4C2B8F644C6537.description: Report orally on a topic or text or present an opinion. This includes:

E6F865CEB0B14EF39934E766F9C454BF.description:
Evaluating the effectiveness of participant interactions and one’s own contributions
to small group activities.

CF6B9763166844C1A16C84A9FE2D50E7.description:
Paraphrasing, summarizing, and writing reflectively in response to the ideas being
discussed.

C80C6C9FDAF44062BA1150191C559161.description:
Communicating agreement or tactful disagreement with others’ ideas using
carefully constructed statements.

362D42597ECA4DFC988E1B78BDBDFA2E.description:
Asking and responding to probing questions and providing appropriate feedback
within structured discussions.

AFD48E2D8F4E409A90D218AAD7729453.description:
Working effectively and respectfully by building on others’ ideas, actively
contributing relevant and well-supported ideas and opinions, and sharing
responsibility for the collaborative work.

9659B2569CD14FCD9D8029EF57304FB8.description: Listening actively through verbal and nonverbal communication and using agreedupon discussion rules.

313F8F90FC4D4A23B5A8DD6A7FE64A5A.description:
Facilitate and contribute to a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade seven topics and texts. This includes:

A9C58AFD57D441A9834936F9DD05A7C5.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

26C20AAE98BF4F08B526F768F95E855B.description: Consult reference materials to check and correct spelling.

66D134DDA8514476AE492C45F44D4B28.description: Recognize and consistently spell frequently used words accurately

B44B529E1E2E4EC6AAC2C45395BF36B3.description: Use and punctuate dialogue and direct quotations appropriately in writing.

082A85820E384908A092135AD925F6E3.description:
Construct complete sentence with appropriate punctuation, avoiding comma splices and
run-ons in writing.

91B1E44F4C0B4CA79DD9F74BF9285312.description: Maintain consistent verb tense across paragraphs in writing.

46C8A515B3054DF28C0441EFDD90356D.description:
Arrange phrases and clauses within a sentence and apply appropriate subject-verb
agreement to improve meaning, reader/listener interest, and style in writing.

73CE88C4B8A2458097EAE8FB427D565C.description: Use specific adjectives and adverbs to enhance speech and writing.

EE89967FF1564EF6AD8629213C52DB10.description:
Recognize and use pronoun-antecedent agreement, including indefinite, reflexive, and
relative pronouns, when speaking and writing.

8C67A2FEFDB04911823EB22ECDB4F376.description:
Construct simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to communicate
ideas clearly and add variety to writing.

8F2ADA836538431CB9D99AA4B9C242B7.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

DF9140D4C89248AA82F74C89B713EE1B.description:
Self-and peer-edit writing for capitalization, spelling, punctuation, sentence structure,
paragraphing, and Standard English (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

DDAD8FEDBB864360BD67CA731EC85AB0.description:
Revise writing for clarity of content, word choice, sentence variety, and transition among
paragraphs.

F2578926231E430B85B295874CCAE696.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

4B33CCA25DC04652A009A86B2BA249BA.description: Expanding and embedding ideas to create sentence variety.

4C031B2A08684212B444733B00CEC9D9.description:
Developing voice and tone by using language that provides vivid and precise
vocabulary to enhance the meaning of the writing.

9CDC26B0A3574AF09F0B2D9377D7A4C3.description:
Using transitions within and between paragraphs to signal shifts in writing and
clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

AABD737150A14368AB3EB19C437A6C99.description:
Defending conclusions or positions with reasons and precise, relevant evidence
(e.g., facts, definitions, details, quotations, and examples).

69E20E32624C4C989B90F810EC3DD4D6.description:
Establishing a central idea that aligns with the thesis and maintains an organized
structure to fit form and topic.

0F45CC5C2FB14EF8A9A4BD267779069C.description: Composing a thesis statement that states a position or explains the purpose.

DE2FE44A1AD744668F450ACDD7404723.description:
Generate and organize ideas using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing)
to develop multi-paragraph texts. This includes:

F334DB491533415497D0CA84BEDBB25D.description:
Write reflectively in response to reading to demonstrate thinking with details, examples,
and other evidence from the text(s).

AAEC2F95837D4C78A6F14856BDB71D8D.description:
Write persuasively supporting a well-defined point of view with appropriate claims,
relevant evidence, and clear reasoning that are logically grouped.

4C88231E8E11467D869A91740DA708C9.description:
Write expository texts to examine a topic or concept that develops the focus with relevant
facts, definitions, concrete details, or other information from multiple credible sources,
using structures and patterns (e.g., description, enumeration, classification, comparison,
problem-solution, or cause-effect) to clarify relationships among ideas.

C52EA48195FD4E5CAA8C4DE0F3F48CF9.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or to alter an existing text, using a
variety of precise words and phrases and transitional words to develop the characters,
convey sequence, and signal shifts from one timeframe or setting to another.

E3E1D1CE10F34BC18F8A163C0BDECE3E.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade seven content and texts.

D2E3FDCBD23A4425B0095A4037AF58C9.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for Foundations for Writing standards.

DD6F7CC26FD44F03BEDB7EA8FF0AB5C5.description:
Compare and contrast how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their
presentations or viewpoints of key information by emphasizing different facts, opinions,
and reasoning.

6449346250D549B899F205166A818BB3.description:
Analyze ideas within and between selections including how specific sentences, paragraphs,
or sections contribute to the development and meaning of ideas.

416D40427CFC46A5A25F158784A52624.description:
Analyze how an author’s purpose(s) reflects the author’s perspective (e.g., beliefs,
assumptions, biases) and influences the meaning of an informational text.

8389357FE3FC430A8C384E3EA549711C.description:
Analyze how an author’s word choice, organizational pattern, and language structure
impact the author’s purpose and support the reader’s comprehension.

4FD3A0DF83C44B3D8012854BF06F1D50.description:
Analyze how an author uses text features (e.g., boldface and italics; type set in color;
underlining; indentation; sidebars; illustrations, graphics and photographs; headings and
subheadings; footnotes and annotations) to enhance and support the reader’s
comprehension.

E616E017F97C433E80AE340529668A42.description:
Trace the argument and specific claims in texts and assess whether all the evidence
presented is relevant and whether irrelevant evidence was introduced.

C10CEA493AF343E9A095527A0F3EC08E.description:
Analyze how the author unfolds a perspective or series of ideas or events in historical,
scientific, or technical texts, including the order in which the points are made and how they
are introduced and developed.

AEE9383341954063875EF4D8CF16D015.description:
Create a main idea statement and provide an accurate summary of how key events or ideas
develop through the text.

EC7B92119987441FA15A66E818B7B7AD.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

3DF6E9DC422B40168067CEE60BC10668.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical
novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

D6194D7E6D8F4981ADE07391C66FBE0B.description:
Explain how particular elements of stories or dramas interact including how settings shape
and influence characters and plot.

F7E925EB95784426BE8B3F81FE2EDB4A.description:
Explain how an author develops the points of view of different characters in a text (e.g.,
first-person, third person limited, third-person omniscient) and how they affect the reader’s
interpretation of a text.

03799D97C3CA4E8AB1D93EA0F3D8F960.description:
Analyze how the elements of an author’s style (e.g., word choice, sentence structure,
dialogue, figurative language, imagery) are used to influence and develop tone.

5CD655FA880442A098136092069D9D88.description:
Analyze how elements of authors’ styles (e.g., word choice, dialogue, form, voice, rhyme,
rhythm, and/or sound devices) contribute to meaning in various forms of prose and poetry.

76E22775F7524CDD915CE8F6B6566D66.description:
Explain how static and dynamic characters and the roles of protagonist and antagonist
influence plot events.

0CBF5FBD1E744740B244690B9937DA5D.description:
Analyze how the central conflict and key elements (e.g., exposition, initiating event, rising
action, climax, falling action, and resolution) impact plot development.

7D7D63F531E940E9A2F419E6C3AF95D8.description:
Describe stated or implied themes of texts and analyze their development throughout the
texts using specific details.

9EFCA3A8E9914248A96E78D84B1095AA.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include short stories,
literary nonfiction, novels, poetry, and drama.

1496CE10F0F64733BB32421BC4D296C6.description:
Use newly learned words and phrases in multiple contexts, including in students’
discussions and speaking and writing activities.

D2C99323E23B41ACA3FC565C6FE429EA.description:
Use general and specialized word-reference materials, print and digital, to identify word
origins and derivations, pronunciations, precise meanings, and their parts of speech.

5F16D878D3394021BCAAA9CAB9470113.description:
Distinguish among the nuances in the meaning of connotations of words with similar
denotations.

FD3C392405C1487C8E6AD4DE53ECDE62.description:
Analyze the construction and meaning of figurative language, including simile, hyperbole,
metaphor, and personification.

408684B512674A1DB60A3405854E2EF2.description:
Use the relationship between particular words, including synonyms, antonyms, and
analogies to better understand each word.

A97DB0A74C554F66B62E1600B5DA738D.description:
Apply knowledge of Greek and Latin roots and affixes to predict the meaning of unfamiliar
words.

F47642263BFD479D8EEBAFA75DA6564F.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or
function in a sentence) to determine the meaning of words or phrases.

75231FE89788478D9B3037947E1D885A.description:
Develop and accurately use general academic language and content-specific vocabulary by
listening to, reading, and discussing a variety of grade-seven texts and topics.

9FEC418BC9A74D8BAF6248614D44558B.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on grade
seven content and texts.

DA1CE1D41D2A4B53831208DD57F8625C.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to text structure,
common organizational structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies, 3-12).

DE8F6E2A5A1746588FEE2AB3BBE4BA7D.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary, K-12).

EB6CE30860EB41A1BE33D26D3F8D0890.description:
When responding to text through discussion and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

C5543F054087475B9649ED4B52AB3406.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the mid-range of the grades 6-8 band. (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

914A9326E02E4535AB3F1B2784B3659B.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

C2A72D93BC9948419FBFE91DE72319D5.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

CA10DCFA944C4878A854DE3EF43ED5CE.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

CA164D1AA8D942A4964F1DBFC6BED219.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for Foundations for Reading standards.
